intro: Notophaena toumatou, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a waxy surface, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathium structures. Notophaena toumatou is adapted to the arid and semi-arid climates of its native habitat, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
